header.title: MALEDICTUM LIBER TERTIUS
header.category: Esoteric Philosophy, Anti-Cosmic Occultism, Left-Hand Path Grimoire

central_thesis: The text outlines a radical anti-cosmic philosophy and practical system for self-deification through the conscious embrace and manifestation of primordial Chaos, Evil, and the Abyss. It advocates for the rejection of all divine and created orders, human limitations, and conventional morality, urging the practitioner to become a vessel for infernal forces, leading to the dissolution of reality and rebirth into a state of demonic immortality and power beyond time and space.

structure_content.summary: This chapter introduces the concept of Chaos as an Eternal Ocean, describing the arising of Archons of Evil, Tehomoth, Abaddon, and carnivorous phantoms from the Abyss. It portrays the Universe's inevitable tearing apart and rebirth into Chaos, emphasizing the transformation of human essence into a 'renaissance of flesh' and the blending of elemental forces leading to cosmic collapse.

This section details Abaddon as the Keeper of Chaos, highlighting the alien and immortal nature of 'They' (the entities or initiates). It describes their existence beyond human comprehension, stained by blood, enduring endless suffering in an icy solitude, and their profound, cursed relationship with both the Abyss and humanity. Key figures like Behemoth, Leviathan, Samael, and Lilith are mentioned in the context of an inevitable world collapse.

The chapter describes the omnipresence of demons, hidden within human ruins and disguised by the 'vestment of the Obscure.' These demons are portrayed as the 'quintessence of alienness' and 'lust of Hell Itself,' continuously opening the Abyss through their ulcered mouths. They are void, immortal, and consume all generated by Light, transforming existence and embodying Chaos from human blood. They seek to possess human essence and facilitate rare individuals in becoming a 'gaping vortex of Abyss' for destruction.

This chapter details the path of the 'chosen one' to become part of the Abyss, starting with a desire to transcend conventional good and evil. It emphasizes that this journey, fueled by a longing for 'transcendental Evil,' involves rejecting divine nature, forming an alliance with Hell and devotion to Devil. The path is a 'self-murder' of the human entity, leading to a new existence as an 'architect of Evil' drawing energy directly from the Abyss.

This section introduces 'Nephelims' as veterans of cosmic war, sons of Satan, embodying Sin and vice. They are presented as rebels who have opened the 'abyss of sinfulness inside,' rejecting divine ideals and killing 'seeds of god.' Their spirit is described as inflexible and adamant, embodying the most obscene manifestations of Sin, leading to the sacrifice of the world to Darkness and the activation of Chaos within.

The chapter dismisses human life cycles as 'Illusions of the Desert' and 'sand,' describing the dominance of Death and Cronus. It portrays the 'gods of the Desert' as demanding bloody sacrifices, and the Earth, Fire, and Heaven as ultimately subservient or betrayed. It asserts that human time is a 'Desert' and that the 'abysmal reapers of Hell,' guided by Azazel, transcend and will settle scores with time.

This chapter asserts that 'Every man is a den of the Beast, for flesh is of Hell,' portraying humanity as vessels for monstrous instincts and inherent hatred. It describes a 'perverted carnal love' and 'lust for death' as core aspects of this existence, aiming to transcend human limits by combining flesh and soul without contradiction. It criticizes those who superficially engage with evil while failing to fully embrace the 'possession of sin, in the possession of flesh, in the possession of vice'.

This section describes 'perishable gods' rising from their graves, driven by vanity and aspiring to possess the 'sacrament of vice.' They are depicted as 'undead' and 'humanized gods' who imitate divine reflexes, but ultimately remain helpless. The text calls for these figures to endure 'lashes, chains, and nails' to subdue their pride and become true players of 'human evil,' aligning with permissiveness and the lust for absolute power.

The chapter outlines the 'Sacred path of Doom into the wolf's gorge of Abyss,' which involves the transformation of the human mind and soul. Devils are presented as agents of Chaos, guiding initiates beyond the 'world of wasted forms,' disturbing human wounds, and unbinding memory. The path necessitates accepting 'titanic denial' and embracing the deepest abysses to fully embody Hell and nurse 'priestesses of their blood' to achieve the 'impossible at any price'.

This chapter focuses on the 'transfiguration of those pernicious ones of humans into Hell,' which is achieved through agony, self-sacrifice, and shedding human skin. The path involves rejecting divine order, instigating cosmic wars, and becoming 'mutilated and dehumanized' to perceive the 'purple ascend from the deep abysses of Darkness.' It emphasizes perverting divine beauty into 'perfectly beautiful' demonic forms, bearing 'bestial bites,' and understanding that true essence lies beyond mere names.

This section critically deconstructs the clergy's interpretation of Hell and their 'divine' path. It accuses them of being too 'humanized' and narrow-minded to comprehend true Satanic might, concealing truth, and setting taboos. The text asserts that their morality and justice are false, advocating for a rebellious spirit that embraces Sin and suffering as a means to transcend human limitations and reject the 'god's creation' and 'Christ's dominion'.

This chapter distinguishes between those who experience Hell through themselves and those who merely know its alienation. The true path requires becoming a 'hard-line subverter, destroyer, conqueror' and embracing Satan as the ultimate reality and Hell as a 'method.' It stresses the importance of Honour and Responsibility in this transformation, advocating for open-hearted acceptance of the Devil's voice and a relentless pursuit of metamorphosis, recognizing that Hell cannot be satiated by a single soul or grasped by reason.

The final chapter declares the initiates as 'Serpent piercing the universe, Saraph,' tasked with tearing down enslaved shrouds and expanding the 'halls of perdition.' It asserts their role in incarnating 'multitudinous phantoms' and avenging themselves through a 'revived movement of the darkest ones.' The chapter emphasizes their relentless struggle, self-immolation, and rejection of 'slaves' values, ultimately aiming to unleash 'all the demons of our spirit' and become 'wise and dangerous' in their quest for ultimate power beyond time.

key_concepts.definition: The primordial, boundless, and insatiable source of all existence and non-existence, from which Chaos and Evil emanate. It is the ultimate reality and destination for the initiated, serving as a gateway and a consuming force that re-forms reality.

The Eternal Ocean, the seething, primal, and untamed force underlying and preceding all created order. It is the raw, destructive, and transformative power to which the Universe will be returned and reborn, representing the true state of being.

Not a moral failing but a transcendental, primordial essence and aspiration. It is the innate force driving the rejection of divine order and human limitations, serving as a path to forbidden knowledge, power, and self-deification. To embrace Evil is to align with the original, uncreated truth.

Far from a place of punishment, Hell is presented as a state of being, a method, a kingdom, and an internal reality. It is the chosen path of severe transformation, honour, responsibility, and ultimate power, accessible through the embrace of primordial forces and the rejection of all divine promises.

A temporary and limited vessel, a 'den of the Beast' and 'flesh of Hell,' whose created essence must be transcended, destroyed, or transformed. Human existence is seen as enslaved, imperfect, and bound by illusions, requiring a 'self-murder' to break free and integrate with the Abyss.

A state achieved through the dissolution of created forms and integration with Chaos and Abyss, rather than a divine afterlife. It is a 'purple ascend' beyond perishability, granting eternal existence within the primordial, free from the cycles of time and the limitations of the human condition.

Not moral transgressions, but innate aspects of primordial nature to be embraced. Sin and vice are seen as means to knowledge, power, and self-liberation, enabling the initiate to break divine laws and transcend the 'sinfulness' imposed by external authorities.

The fierce, wild, and devouring inner demonic nature that resides within every man. It is born from Chaos and embodies monstrous instincts, representing the untamed, primordial essence to be awakened and integrated by the initiate for power and transformation.

Initiates or entities who have embodied the spirit of Satan, veterans of cosmic war, and rebels against divine order. They represent those who fully embrace Sin and rise above human limitations, embodying the most obscene manifestations of primordial Evil and leading the charge against created existence.

Key virtues for the initiate on the Left-Hand Path, distinct from conventional morality. Honour signifies loyalty to the chosen path and primordial essence, while Responsibility denotes the conscious acceptance of the consequences of radical self-transformation and the rejection of divine excuses.

A deliberate act of transcending human limits, metaphorically or literally, by 'killing' the human self. It is the 'price' paid to become one with the Abyss, an internal dissolution necessary for the integration of demonic essences and the attainment of higher states of being, free from the created order.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is one of self-transformation and deification, aimed at aligning the individual with primordial Chaos, Evil, and the Abyss. It necessitates a radical rejection of established divine and created orders, human limitations, and conventional moral frameworks. The practitioner is expected to become a conscious vessel for infernal forces, integrating demonic essences, and actively participating in the dissolution of current reality for a rebirth into a state of 'demonic immortality.' This is a path of constant internal and external struggle, extreme self-sacrifice (a 'self-murder' of the limited self), and the cultivation of an unyielding will.
tools: Adamantine Will: An unyielding, inflexible will to pursue the chosen path, rejecting all compromise.
Rebellious Spirit: A spirit of defiance against divine and human laws, cultivated through acts of 'Sin' and 'vice'.
Unholy Mind: A mind expanded beyond human rationality, capable of perceiving and integrating chaotic realities.
Own Blood: Utilized as a symbolic or literal 'sacrifice' and a medium for transformation, embodying the 'price' paid for the path.
Suffering: Embraced and transformed into a source of power, rather than avoided, as a catalyst for deeper insight and strength.
Sin/Vice: Employed as vehicles for forbidden knowledge, breaking limitations, and asserting primal nature.
Honour & Responsibility: Core ethical principles for the initiate, guiding actions without reliance on external moral codes.
The Beast (internal): The awakened inner monstrous nature, cultivated and integrated as a source of primal power.
Infernal Instinct: Intuitive connection to the forces of Hell and Abyss, guiding actions beyond human reason.
Self-Murder (metaphorical/literal): The conscious act of dismantling the human ego and its limitations to facilitate apotheosis.
Fire: Represents the transformative, consuming, and purifying power of Hell and the Abyss.
Chaos: The raw material and ultimate goal, providing the energetic medium for all transformations.
rituals: Conscious 'self-murder' or self-sacrifice of the human ego/limitations to become Abyss, often involving symbolic or literal 'payment' through one's own blood or suffering.
Incarnating and manifesting 'pain and hatred' as transformative forces.
Systematic 'desecration of heaven and earth' through philosophical rejection and adversarial actions.
Opening the 'abyss of sinfulness inside' by embracing inherent 'vice' and 'sin' as sources of power.
Feeding 'the Beast' within oneself, cultivating monstrous instincts and primordial desires.
Forging oneself 'into Hell,' undergoing internal transformation to embody its essence.
Becoming a 'gaping vortex of Abyss,' serving as a conduit for its consuming power.
Partaking of 'Their poisonous nature' through symbolic or actual ingestion of blood/flesh, signifying integration with infernal essences.
Devouring 'resisting souls alive,' metaphorically consuming limitations or opposition.
Leading 'all the colours of liberating agony through their own self,' embracing suffering as a catalyst for liberation.
Unleashing 'Hell on mortal horizons,' manifesting infernal forces in the external world.
Trampling down the 'sprouts of harmful humanity,' rejecting and destroying weakness.
Celebrating 'Death with crowns of thorn thunderstorms,' a ritualistic embrace of dissolution and the adversarial.

relevant_quotes.text: Eternal Ocean of Chaos seethes with Its waters under the gravity of the deadly star. Darken face of the Underworld coils in Its tides and worries the monster which came ashore out of Abyss and became that shore by the terrible menacing roar of Tehomoth.

O Chaos, thus Hell yearn you return and call to you to feed you and to see as the Universe will be torn apart by the jaws of Abaddon and reborn in your integrity. Earth is saturated with ominous emanations of fallen creatures; cities are burning with breath of your nearness...
Abaddon is stretched behind them, by their shade, Keeper of the gates of Chaos, Angel of the Abyss.
Immortal and blood-stained are they, who desecrated the heaven, desecrated the earth...
Every man is a den of the Beast, for flesh is of Hell.
The longing for transcendental Evil, pernicious for a human, lies at the roots of everything, and becomes the very beginning of his never-ending whirl in the unrestrained vortex of primordial Chaos.
To stand in Satan – that is our only reality. Here Hell is a method.
To learn from the Devil – is the price of their self-dependence.
Only Responsibility makes one free truly. Only Honour lets us remain in this Responsibility. Hell is our Honour and measure of our Responsibility.
And that they perceived - can never exist in serenity anymore... Leaving themselves by angels wings, by demons paths, they use their own human less and less.
Sacred path of Doom into the wolf's gorge of Abyss...

Hell cannot be satiated with a single human soul, as well as It cannot be grasped with reason, nor seen with eyes, but only sensed; not explained by helpless human rationality, for in our yesterday It will differ from the Hell of today.
Our praise to Satan; Ode to our home...

We are - Serpent piercing the universe, Saraph who's taken the earth in his infernal embrace... It's our dower to tear its enslaved shrouds and widen the halls of perdition, disgorging other worlds and alien spaces endlessly; its rough flesh – is just an anvil for our success, and we are to forge the hearts of steel golems who will smash its shells, we are to drive with our blows its deadened spirit into Tartarus... devour its innermost bones and drain dry its still blood... to prevail in final coup de grace...
The satanic instinct of opposition and primordial diabolic spirit accompany the maleficent desire of a man of perdition to become one of Their kind...

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to contemporary Left-Hand Path (LHP) traditions, particularly anti-cosmic Satanism, Chaos Gnosticism, and radical self-deification movements. It provides a dense, poetic, and philosophically rigorous articulation of an adversarial stance against all perceived divine or created orders. Its emphasis on primordial Chaos, the Abyss, and a transgressive path to power resonates strongly with currents in modern occultism that seek liberation and apotheosis through a radical embrace of 'Evil' as an essential, non-moral force. The work's rejection of conventional spirituality and human limitations offers a clear philosophical foundation for such practices, placing it within a lineage of thought that values strength, will, and self-responsibility above all else.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists primarily of advanced practitioners of Left-Hand Path magic, anti-cosmic Satanists, and philosophical Luciferians. It is for individuals who are actively engaged in extreme forms of self-transformation, seeking to transcend human and cosmic limitations through adversarial means. The text is not suitable for beginners in occultism, those seeking light-oriented or benevolent practices, or individuals unprepared for radical philosophical and psychological confrontation with concepts of dissolution, suffering, and primordial chaos.
